Name: Last Tome
Flavor (Project): A fount of ancient knowledge, almost dried up now. Contains enough information to allow us to mount a response to the Primordials. It'll serve us well as the cornerstone of our research
Flavor (Tech): Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, poring over dusty tomes and phos scripture
Abilities: Research: Reference. When you reach a Combat @CombatTech or Structural @StructuralTech node on the Timeline, research one of the available Technology cards from the corresponding Projects Deck.; Gather Information: Reference. During the Exploration Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map Tile with @Progress symbol, gain +1 @Progress. For each @Progress you gain, place 1 @Progress token on your current Story card or the Inward Odyssey card

Name: Primordial Dawn
Flavor (Project): Not much is known about the Eschaton, except that it brought the Fall of Olympus and the Coming of the Primordials
Flavor (Tech): From here the Argonauts shape their fate and steer the mighty Argo towards its unknown destination
Abilities: Sail and Explore: Reference. At the start of each day you move to an adjacent tile using one of the available waterways. If needed, place the tile, then move the Argo and proceed to the Timeline Step.; Adventure: Reference. During the Adventure Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map tile with the @AdventureHub symbol, go to the Adventure Hubs table in your current Cycle's Storybook.; Gather Resources: Reference. During the Exploration Step after resolving Exploration symbols, draw and resolve two stacks of Exploration cards

Name: Antikratos Project
Flavor (Project): There is a lot we do not know about the Triskelion Junction used in the process of supressing the atavistic nature of the Titans. We need to know more
Flavor (Tech): Here the Argonauts ready for their next excursion and it is also here that a Support Team stands ready to lend their help
Abilities: Argo Support I: Permanent. Argo Ability Limit: 2

Name: Argo Works
Flavor (Project): The Argo is a marvel of engineering, but there's no denying the fact that most of its systems are inactive or unknown to us. We need to start by setting up a production hub
Flavor (Tech): To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of @Gear and new engineering solutions
Abilities: Craft Gear: Reference. During the Advancement Step, you can use available resources to craft @Gear cards using Production Technologies

Name: Titanogenesis
Flavor (Project): They are a mystery to us. Mindless and extremely violent in the wild, they would be Mortalkind greatest enemy, had it not been for the Eschaton. Now they're our best hope for the future
Flavor (Tech): Here the Titans are tamed and stored when not in use. Some call this place a warehouse. some call it a prison
Abilities: Gain Titan: Reference. During the Exploration Step, if the Argo is on an unexplored Map Tile with the @Titan symbol, gain +1 Titan. Titan Stoa Capacity: Titan Limit: 10

Name: Trading Solutions
Flavor (Project): If we are to survive, we need to strengthen our connection to the people of Crete
Leads To: Diplomatic Relations, Advanced Trading Solutions, Crew Expansion, Shallows Navigation
Flavor (Tech): A small ship dock will allow us to take in traders and establish connections around the island
Abilities: Theban Trader: Immediate. Add the Theban Trader Exploration card to the Exploration deck.; Port Trading: City Negotiation. Gain +1 @ArgoFate to exchange (up to 3 times):<<NL>>3 Trireme >> 1 Armament<<NL>> 2 Trireme >> 1 Monument<<NL>>1 Monument >> 2 Trireme<<NL>>1 Armament >> 3 Trireme<<NL>>1 Muscle Cluster or Infused Mechanism >> 3 Raw Ambrosia<<NL>>1 Calcified Knuckle Bone or Fleshy Mantle >> 4 Raw Ambrosia<<NL>>3 Raw Ambrosia >> 1 Muscle Cluster or Infused Mechanism<<NL>>4 Raw Ambrosia >> 1 Calcified Knuckle Bone or Fleshy Mantle

Name: Intelligence Gathering
Flavor (Project): If we are to master our fate, we need to know what lies ahead. This is the first step in establishing a permanent informant network
Flavor (Tech): Your informants will periodically bring you news - good or otherwise
Abilities: Informant Network: Immediate. Add the [Informant Network|AB0110] Exploration card to the Exploration deck

Name: Shallows Navigation
Flavor (Project): The phos scriptures tell of a dormany subsystem of the Argo's engines that allows shallow water navigation
Leads To: Argo Onboarding, Pursuer Problem, Excursion Propylon II
Flavor (Tech): The Argo rises above the waterline and almost glides on the river surface
Abilities: Shallows Navigation: Permanent. You can move through @Lock waterways with the River @River symbol

Name: Rhetoric
Flavor (Project): The Labyrinthians talk about nothingness with devout passion. We need a message of our own
Leads To: Anti-Indoctrination Philosophy, Minoan Investigations, Titan Hunting
Flavor (Tech): Let all who doubt their purpose despair not, for this ship is in itself a message: we are here for a reason
Abilities: Persuasion: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to gain @Strangers to test Diplomacy (7+). *Success*: Lower this @Strangers gain by 1 (to a minimum of 0).; Diatribe: City Negotiation. Gain +1 @ArgoFate to lose -1 @Strangers

Name: Diplomatic Relations
Flavor (Project): We've walked blindly into this crisis. Now's the time to learn about the island and acclimate
Flavor (Tech): Our envoys establish our presence on the island
Abilities: Diplomatic Corps: City Negotiation. Lose 4 Mortal resources of your choosing and gain +1 @ArgoFate to gain +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction

Name: Pursuer Problem
Flavor (Project): That creature does not tire nor rest. It will not stop hunting us. We need time to figure out how to kill it
Flavor (Tech): Engines grow silent though the Argo still moves, like Charon's boat
Abilities: Stealth Drive: Gain +1 @ArgoFate during Adversary Activation to lower the Adversary movement by 1 (to a minimum of 0). This does not stop Adversary from spawning!

Name: Peace
Flavor (Project): It's never too late to reconcile your differences
Requirements: At War, lose 1 Titan, Diplomatic Relations
Flavor (Tech): And with an offering, let past grievances fade away
Abilities: Peace Talks: Immediate. Choose 1 Faction you are At War with and immediately set your Diplomacy Score with this Faction to '-8'. This ability ignores the normal restrictions of the 'At War' Diplomacy Threshold

Name: Anti-Indoctrination Philosophy
Flavor (Project): The message of the Labyrinthians is insidious, as it takes root in fear and fear is constant. We must guard against it
Flavor (Tech): The Philosopher Guards quickly became a beacon around which the discourse of Purpose flourished
Abilities: Philosopher Guards: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to test Diplomacy (7+). Success: Chosen Argonaut discards a Despair token.; Maze Exorcism: Lose -1 Priest to make one Argonaut lose the Mazetouched Affliction

Name: Hope Logic
Flavor (Project): For nothingness does not exist without Purpose to which it stands in opposition. It fears it and tries to douse it with doubt
Flavor (Tech): And in that moment it betrays its weakness. For if there was no Hope of Purpose prevailing, why go to such lengths to silence it? Hope
Abilities: Font Infinite: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to gain @Doom during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (X+), where X is 9 minus the number of your current Doom card.<<NL>>*Success:* Lower this @Doom gain by 1 (to a minimum of 0)

Name: Argo Onboarding
Flavor (Project): Without proper parts and equipment, we cannot bring the ship to its full potential. But we are learning
Flavor (Tech): There are certain things we can do to minimize the impact hull damage has on our voyage
Abilities: Reinforced Hull: Immediate. Gain +1 @Hull.; Daedalus Workshop: Permanent. During the Exploration Step, if the _Argo_ is on an unexplored Map tile with the @DaedalusWorkshop symbol, gain +1 @Hull.; Emergency Repairs: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to lose @Hull during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (X+), where X is 3 plus your current @Hull value.<<NL>>*Success:* Lower this @Hull loss by 1 (to a minimum of 0)

Name: Deeply Embedded Spies
Flavor (Project): The news of our exploits brings hope to many. Some want to repay that renewed sense of purpose and help our cause
Requirements: 45+ explored Map tiles, Anti-Indoctrination Philosophy, Intelligence Gathering
Flavor (Tech): Along our journey we made a difference for a lot of people and that selflessness pays out in dividends
Abilities: Theseus Web: Gain +2 @ArgoFate when the _Argo_ is on an explored Map tile with the @Progress symbol to test Diplomacy (7+).<<NL>>*Success:* Gain +1 @Progress

Name: Excursion Propylon II
Flavor (Project): These Primordials are getting too much to handle. The Argo must rise to the challenge
Flavor (Tech): The rebuilt Propylon will allow the Argo a far greater presence during battles
Abilities: Argo Support II: Permanent. AA Limit: 3

Name: Mnestis Thesis
Flavor (Project): These glimpses we're having, these past lives... there must be an easier way to access them
Flavor (Tech): From here we rise and to here we are brought when we cease to be. There are answers in this chamber, only thing we need to do is listen
Abilities: Reflect: Gain +1 @ArgoFate and write an Argonaut's name on the Timeline (event), 7 days from now. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event. When you resolve this event, the Argonaut gains +1 Mnemos Node for a chosen Mnemos card

Name: Minoan Investigations
Flavor (Project): We need to follow up on these loose threads, who knows where they can lead us..
Flavor (Tech): Regular scouting expeditions are starting to bear fruit
Abilities: Scout Reports: Permanent. You may re-roll your Adventure Hubs Table roll (once)

Name: Titan Hunting
Flavor (Project): There's only a handful of Titans onboard the Argo. If we are meant to survive, we need to... procure more
Flavor (Tech): Only philosophers are able to subdue wild Titans and bring them to the Argo, but they refuse to share their secrets
Abilities: Titanokinigos: Immediate. Add the [Untamed Titan|AB0108] Exploration card to the Exploration deck.; Expedition: Gain +1 @ArgoFate when the Argo is on a Map tile with @Titan symbol to test Diplomacy (7+). Success: Gain +1 Titan

Name: Titan Rearing
Flavor (Project): A set of rules and practices that will allow us to house more Titans effectively
Flavor (Tech): With the new practices in place, we can expand our Titan roster
Abilities: Titan Stoa Capacity II: Permanent. Titan Limit: 15.; Comeback: If you win a Battle that you started with less than 4 Titans, after the Battle gain +X @ArgoFate to gain as many Dreamwalker Titans as to have a total of 4 Titans in the Stoa. X is the number of Titans gained

Name: Archeolinguistics
Flavor (Project): These symbols are not merely decorative...
Flavor (Tech): It is a language, long forgotten. With time, we may learn to decipher it
Abilities: Centimanes Glyphs: Permanent. @CentimanesOne is 'one'.<<NL>>During your Voyages, you will encounter other glyphs that will help you decode the Centimanes Scripts (sequences of glyphs) and find the secret Centimanes paragraphs in the Main Story. These will be denoted by a @ThumbsUp at the beginning of the paragraph. If the paragraph doesn't show this symbol, you must've made a mistake in your decoding -- don't read it! If that's the case, gain +1 @ArgoFate

Name: Advanced Trading Solutions
Flavor (Project): Remember the old saying: "You do not win a war with swords. You win it with bread."
Flavor (Tech): Your agents arrive in town before the Argo and lay the groundwork for successful negotiations
Abilities: Trade Agents: Permanent. First time you use a Negotiation Ability each day, you may ignore its associated @ArgoFate gain

Name: Crew Expansion
Flavor (Project): A lot of the men and women who joined us on Kephallonia have died or departed. If we don't replace them, we'll soon command a ship of ghosts
Flavor (Tech): There's a lot of people who enlist only for the promise of a roof over their head and a bowl of warm soup. We need to watch them closely, for they may prove flighty
Abilities: Port Recruitment: City Negotiation. Gain +1 @ArgoFate and +1 @Strangers to gain +1 @Crew

Name: Advanced Crew Expansion
Flavor (Project): We need to send out recruiters who actively look for volunteers to our cause
Flavor (Tech): Each time only a few brace to join our ranks. The most determined, strong-willed and driven. We wouldn't have it any other way
Abilities: Minoan Security Protocols: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to lose @Crew during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test (Diplomacy 7+).<<NL>>*Success:* Lower this @Crew loss by 1 (to a minimum of 0)

Name: Superior Trading Solutions
Flavor (Project): Argo is a big ship. A floating city. It's time to bring commerce to us
Abilities: Porta of Strangers: Trading

Name: Spark of the Dead Gods
Flavor (Project): The gods may be dead, but they left plenty of evidence of their existence and passing
Flavor (Tech): In this temple to the fleeting memory of tyrannous idols, fates are shaped and powers seized
Abilities: Godforms: Permanent. From now on you can Awaken! (See Rulebook). When you gain a Godform, note it on the Argo Sheet in the Godforms section.; Bend Fate: Lose -1 Priest to lose -1 @ArgoFate

Name: Strange Alliance
Flavor (Project): The Olympians are dead, their Mount razed and their cults scattered. Howbeit, nature abhors a vacuum
Flavor (Tech): The Nymphs are completely alien to us, their motives unknown and unscrupulous. Yet they may be bargained with...
Abilities: Mythic Allies: Permanent. You can summon Nymphs (see Rulebook). Summon Limit: 1.; Hymn of the New: Gain +1 @Doom and lose -2 Priests to regain a spent Summon Charge.; Gain +2 @ArgoFate and +2 @Doom to regain a spent Summon Charge

Name: Forgotten Knowledge
Flavor (Project): The Last Tome has much to teach us still, its one and only page, written in phos scripture, divulges new information each time it is used
Flavor (Tech): Here the philosophers and academicians conduct their research, pouring over dusty tomes and phos scriptures
Abilities: Forgotten Knowledge: Reference. When you start a new Cycle II campaign, tak eall of the Combat and Structural Technology cards you have researched and remove all that have the 'Cycle I only' tag. You won't need those in Cycle II. Note that you will also have a very limited use of Cycle I Production Facilities, so you may remove these cards too. Permanent. Crew Limit: 8, Hull Limit: 5. (You cannot gain @Crew or @hull if they would exceed this limit.)

Name: Argo's Mission
Flavor (Project): Your time on Crete has changed you, you now have a purpose. To bring hope and peace to a post-Eschaton world
Flavor (Tech): From here the Argonauts shape their fate and steer the mighty Argo towards its victory
Abilities: Visiting Traders: Trading

Name: Nietzschean Sighting
Flavor (Project): The Spartan summons and controls the Nietzschean monster, seemingly at will and from thin air
Abilities: Crippled Titans: Reference. If a Titan is crippled, it is not killed. It still takes space in the Titan Stoa, but you cannot junction with it in Battle, use it for Titan Breeding, or lose it as a penalty for any reason

Name: Temenos Project
Flavor (Project): Temenos was a formidable foe. Even in death, his body retains transformative properties and his maze shell is harder than stone
Flavor (Tech): In one of the vast holds of the Argo, the carcass of Temenos is mind for valuable resources. The pit of despair transformed into a font of hope
Abilities: Labyrinthian Mine: The Exploration deck has several cards showing your mining efforts. These cards award you with Temenos Primordial resources.<<NL>>If you are on Story 2A or further, during Advancement Steop you may trade these resources for War Triremes (any number of times):<<NL>>1 Maze Fragment <<>> 1 War Trireme<<NL>>1 Fear Essence <<>> 1 War Trireme

Name: Argo Works II
Flavor (Project): Alkibiades Argo Works is the living, beating heart of the ship. This is where dreams become reality
Leads To: Mobile Trade Fleet Dock, Canal Reconnaissance, Argo Security
Flavor (Tech): To stand a chance against the Primordials, the smiths and priests of the Argo work tirelessly on new types of gear and new engineering solutions
Abilities: Abyss Power: Reference. When instructed to apply Ascendency rules, all Gear cards with a Power Level lower than II (and without the Ascended keyword) incur the following penalties for the remainder of the Cycle:<<NL>>(Weapons only) When you attack with this weapon, you cannot use any tokens from the Kratos Pool or place any tokens in the Kratos Pool.<<NL>>You do not benefit from {Power Re-roll X}.<<NL>>Increase all @Fate cost on the card by 1.<<NL>>(Armor and Shield only) -1 @Potential on Armor Roll<<NL>>-1 Evasion re-roll @EvasionReroll (to a minimum of 0)<<NL>>-1 Evasion bonus @Evasion (to a minimum of 0)

Name: Titanomorphosis
Flavor (Project): As we learn more about the Titans and their tendencies, we unlock some of their hidden potential: we call it Argo Breeding
Leads To: Titan Breeding, Spartan Investigations, Political Protection
Flavor (Tech): Here the Titans are tamed and stored when not in use. Some call this place a warehouse, some call it a prison
Abilities: Titanomorphosis: Reference. Unlike Fused Titans, Titans created through Titan Breeding don't require a Primordial Core, unless it is specifically stated.; Titan Stoa Capacity II: Permanent. Titan Limit: 15

Name: Mnestis Theater
Flavor (Project): A chamber in which a user can experience an illusory physical environment could be the greatest of training rooms
Flavor (Tech): What would Plato say of us now? Shadows casting shadows?
Abilities: Mnestis Applications: Permanent. You've unlocked the Mnestis Theatre

Name: Nymph Studies
Flavor (Project): We know the Nymphs can be persuaded to help our cause, it's just a matter of finding out the best way to appease them
Flavor (Tech): Do they have a stake in this game? Or are we mere playthings?
Abilities: Adyton Extension: Permanent. Summon Limit: 2

Name: Political Protection
Flavor (Project): There may be some who oppose the Nietzschean's rule. If we grant them protectoin, they may server as a useful source of information
Flavor (Tech): Defectors and informants risk their lives to help your cause
Abilities: Asylum: Permanent. You can gain Defectors. Immediate. Gain +1 Defector.; Subterfuge: Lose -1 Defector when you are about to perform a Diplomacy test or any test or roll in the Adventure Phase to add +3 to the result

Name: Refugee Relief Effort
Flavor (Project): The war is displacing whole communities. We can offer them a safe haven
Flavor (Tech): There is nothing more satisfying than the look on the faces of a family reunited
Abilities: Argo Community: City Negotation. Gain +X @ArgoFate and lose -1 @Refugees to gain +1 Humanity and +1 Diplomacy with the Local Faction. %Hidden or Distrustful%: X is 1. %Friendly or Allied%: X is 2.; Black Breath Cure: Lose -1 Priest to make one Argonaut lose the Black Breath Affliction

Name: Recruitment Programs
Flavor (Project): The war is taking its toll on your crew. You need to double your recruitment efforts. The refugees are more than eager to volunteer
Flavor (Tech): This is their chance to make things right, reclaim their homes and their lives
Abilities: Refugee Enrollment: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to test Diplomacy (7+). *Success*: You may lose -1 @Refugees to gain +1 @Crew

Name: Refugee Integration
Flavor (Project): The once nigh-indestructible Argo has seen better days. There are too many repairs to perform and too few hands to carry them out
Flavor (Tech): You crew and your refugee friends work hand in hand to keep the Argo going
Abilities: Volunteer Repair Crews: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to lose @Hull during the Voyage or Adventure Phase, to test (X+), where X is 9 minus the number of Refugees you have. *Success*: Lower this @Hull loss by 1 (to a minimum of 0). If you roll a '1', lose -1 @Refugees

Name: Spartan Investigations
Flavor (Project): Your experiences on Crete dictate you should establish a robust scout network
Flavor (Tech): Your scouts direct you to the places you're most needed at
Abilities: Lakonian Scout Reports: Permanent. After you roll on the Adventure Hubs table, you may choose to resolve an adventure from the hub you rolled or the one in the row directly above

Name: Theseus Method
Flavor (Project): The next logical step. The Nietzschean is waging a shadow war, the sooner you muster your own shadow warriors, the better
Flavor (Tech): The work of a spy is thankless, but it saves lives
Abilities: Spy Network: Immediate. Add the [Spy Network|BB1242] Exploration card to the Exploration deck

Name: Grassroot Support
Flavor (Project): Establishing relations with the local populations will help in your information gathering efforts
Flavor (Tech): There is something here, the Symmachy would call it synoikismos. You would call it unity of purpose
Abilities: Resistance Spies: Gain +1 @ArgoFate when the _Argo_ is on an explored tile with the @Progress symbol to test Diplomacy (7+).<<NL>>*Success:* Gain +1 @Progress.; Allied Intelligence: City Negotation. Gain +1 @ArgoFate to gain +1 @Progress

Name: Mobile Trade Fleet Dock
Flavor (Project): Trading is almost impossible in times of war. But smuggling isn't trading
Flavor (Tech): The Thebans, the Nubians, the various unaligned movers: they all smell opportunity
Abilities: Smuggler Contacts: Immediate. Add the [Smugglers|BB1253] Exploration card to the Exploration deck

Name: Alliance Contacts
Flavor (Project): We need to be heard, we need to be seen. The people of Sparta need to know we come to help
Flavor (Tech): Trust is slow to build, but it is always worth it
Abilities: Reconnaissance: City Negotation. If Hidden or Distrustful with the Local Faction, lose a total of X Maze Fragment, Fear Essence, and/or Mortal resources to gain +1 to this Faction's Diplomacy value. X is your current Diplomacy value with this Faction.; Recruitment: Gain +1 @ArgoFate and lose 4 Relief resources to add the [Recruitment Drive|BB1241] Exploration card to the Exploration deck

Name: Mobile Trade Fleet Hub
Flavor (Project): Turning the Trade Fleet Dock into a mobile smuggler haven will allow us free access to goods from all over Sparta
Abilities: Black Market: City Negotation. Trading

Name: Canal Reconnaissance
Flavor (Project): Great River Works. And here you thought you were done with mazes. It's time to map them out
Abilities: Vanguard Hemiolias: Immediate. Place a generic token on this card. This is the Hemiolia token.; Scout Ship: If the Hemiolia token is on this card, choose an unexplored Map tile number adjacent to the _Argo_. Reveal that tile and place the Hemiolia token on it. Treat this tile as unexplored.<<NL>>*Recall Scout Ship:* If the Hemiolia token is on a Map tile, test Diplomacy (8+) to recall it (use the Diplomacy modifier of the Local Faction on the tile with the Hemiolia token). *Success:* Place the Hemiolia token on this card. *Fail:* Discard the Hemiolia token. When you move onto the tile with the Hemiolia token, you must immediately resolve the ability above, adding +3 to the result.<<NL>>*Create Scout Ship:* If the Hemiolia token is discarded, lose 5 Trireme or 2 War Trireme resources and gain +1 @ArgoFate to add the _Vanguard Hemiolia_ Event to the Timeline, 4 days from now. When you resolve this event, place the Hemiolia token on this card

Name: Up-stream Navigation
Flavor (Project): Argo's aeolipile engines are running on a fraction of their maximum power, or so the engineers claim. Let's put it to the test
Leads To: Sluice Gate System Integration, Wartime Protocols, Ambrosia Spill Solution
Flavor (Tech): Argo cannot take a continued strain on its engines. But in short bursts, it can be tactically advantageous
Abilities: Turbo-charged Engine: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to move through a @Lock waterway with the Up-stream symbol.; Gain +1 @ArgoFate during the Movement Step to test (8+).<<NL>>*Success:* Ignore Blockades and Ambrosia Sludge

Name: Sluice Gate System Integration
Flavor (Project): There is a Second Cataract up north. If we integrate the Ignition system into the Argo, we won't even need to take a gate fortress
Flavor (Tech): An onboard machina breaks the gate's cypher and sends a counterfeit signal
Abilities: Sluice Remote Ignition: Immediate. Gain the [Second Cataract Fortification Line|BC1177] Clue card (Secret deck 5, card 39). Permanent. You can move through @Lock waterways with the Second Cataract symbol

Name: Argo Security
Flavor (Project): There are many people coming onboard the Argo nowadays, too many to count. We need to tighten security
Flavor (Tech): You can recognize the Guard Mora soldiers by the red stripes on their uniforms
Abilities: Guard Mora: Save. Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you are about to lsoe @Crew during the Voyage or Adventure Phase to test Diplomacy (7+).<<NL>>*Success:* Lower this @Crew loss by 1 (to a minimum of 0)

Name: War Recruitment
Flavor (Project): Many among our Allies' ranks wish to serve on the Argo. It's time we let them
Flavor (Tech): Many volunteers flock to our cause
Abilities: Call to Arms: City Negotation. Gain +1 @ArgoFate to gain +1 @Crew

Name: War Propylon
Flavor (Project): The original Propylon wasn't built to handle war operations
Flavor (Tech): It's comforting to know the Argo has your back
Abilities: Argo Support III: Permanent. Argo Ability (AA) Limit: 4

Name: Wartime Protocols
Flavor (Project): The Argo wasn't built as a warship, but it needs to become one
Flavor (Tech): You promise yourselves, you will dismantle most of this Ares-cursed equipment once the war is over
Abilities: Spartan Retrofitting: Immediate. Gain +1 @Crew and +1 @Hull. Permanent. Crew Limit: 9, Hull Limit: 6

Name: Argo Maintenance
Flavor (Project): As Alkibiades and his crews learn the ins and outs of the Argo, more on the fly repairs become a possibility - provided you have access to a shipyard
Flavor (Tech): There is a lot of shared concepts between the Symmachy's vessels designs and the Argo. Though the latter seems aeons ahead, technologically
Abilities: General Repairs: City Negotation. Gain +2 @ArgoFate to gain +1 @Hull

Name: Titan Breeding
Flavor (Project): The anitkratos philosophers are ready to expand their Titan work
Flavor (Tech): Your time on Crete has left you with a purpose - and new Titans to help you along the way
Abilities: Cretan Strains Breeding: Lose 1 Dreamwalker Titan to note a Mazerunner, Earthshaker,_ or _Logicbreaker_ Event on the Timeline, 10 days from now. When you resolve this event, gain one Titan of the corresponding class. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve the event.; Accelerated Cretan Breeding: You may gain +1 @ArgoFate to use Cretan Strains Breeding with Cooldown: 12 days. If you do, write the chosen Breeding event 5 days from now instead

Name: Grand Stoa
Flavor (Project): A new home for your Titans
Flavor (Tech): As the Stoa expands, you are able to sustain a growing herd of Titans
Abilities: Titan Stoa Capacity III: Permanent. Titan Limit: 20.; Dreamwalker Breeding: Note the _Dreamwalker_ Event on the Timeline, 9 days from now. When you resolve this event, gain 1 Dreamwalker Titan. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

Name: Titan Training
Flavor (Project): Titans are natural warriors. But what if you trained them?
Abilities: Titan Gymnasion: Immediate. Form the Gymnasion deck: Find all Cycle I and Cycle II Pattern cards and all Pattern cards that you gained in Cycle III (except the ones currently assigned to Titans).; Gain +1 @ArgoFate to note a _Titan's name (Training)_ Event on the Timeline, 7 days from now. When you resolve this event, that Titan may gain one of the Pattern (Training) or Pattern (Conditioning) cards from the Gymnasion deck. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event

Name: Old Transportation System
Flavor (Project): The Helots tell of old roads for ships. It's worth investigating
Flavor (Tech): The diolkos network, though ancient, is still usable. Such is the legacy of Leleges stonework
Abilities: Diolkos Access: Gain +1 @ArgoFate to travel through a @Lock waterway with the Diolkos symbol. Cannot be used during Story 3A

Name: Counterintelligence
Flavor (Project): The Argo has been infiltrated by spies and saboteurs. It's time to weed them out
Requirements: Refugee Relief Effort, Spartan Investigations, Argo Security
Flavor (Tech): Krypteia has found its match
Abilities: Argo Investigators: Immediate. Remove a random Sabotage card from the Exploration deck. Permanent. For the purpose of Sabotage card effects, treat your @Refugees value as 1 lower

Name: Trauma Growth
Flavor (Project): The Nietzschean's propensity for cruelty has left your Titans crippled. That was his mistake
Flavor (Tech): Trauma is nothing to strive for, but when it happens, it is a chance for a rebirth
Abilities: Rehabilitation: Choose a crippled Titan. Note a _Titan's name (Rehabilitation)_ event on the Timeline, 7 days from now. When you resolve this event, the chosen Titan stops being crippled. You cannot use this ability again until you resolve this event. ; Counseling: Lose -1 Priest. Chosen Argonaut loses the Consumed by Rage Affliction

Name: Ambrosia Spill Solution
Flavor (Project): The Argo Works are certain they can use the technology of the Aeolipilean Engineroom to combat ambrosia
Flavor (Tech): The liquifier breaks the bonds of the ambrosia mass, making it easier to navigate or harvest
Abilities: Ambrosia Liquifier: Gain +1 @ArgoFate when you draw the [Ambrosia Spill|BB1251] or [Black Sludge|BB1250] Exploration card to discard it without resolving its effect and gain 3 Violent Ambrosia resources

Name: First Tome
Flavor (Project): You have clung to the Last Tome as the last vestige of a dying civiliization. But you had it all wrong. It all starts here. It's not the Last Tome. It's the First
